URL Actions for iOS: My Up-to-Date Guide

Feb 14, 2014
12 minute read

There’s one area (in my opinion) where Android clearly beats the pants off of iOS: application sharing (that is, an app’s ability to share data/status/etc. with other apps).

Unfortunately, iOS plays in a rather locked down playground; sharing between apps is limited to a set of strictly defined behaviors. This is rarely ideal.

Long ago, developers began to poke holes in this strict environment. By exploiting the fact that an app can have it’s own URL scheme, it became possible to pass data back and forth between apps. The development of the x-callback-url standard only added to the toolkit, allowing developers to define what should happen when a URL scheme request succeeds, fails, or is canceled.

I’ve come up with several uses of URL actions that improve my workflow on iOS. Instead of constantly publishing new posts about them, I’m going to keep adding to this one. Note that in general, I don’t include every workflow I’ve come up with; there are many that are straightforward and contain no blinding insight of my own. Rather, I include the ones that might be a bit more uncommon and not so out-of-the-box.

Mobile Bookmarklets

  • Append Current URL to Evernote Note (via Drafts)
  • Send Current URL to Buffer
  • Send Current URL to Drafts
  • Send Current URL to Instapaper
  • Send Current URL to MacBook
  • Send Current URL to OmniFocus
  • Send Current URL to Pinboard (via Pinner)
  • Send Current URL to Pushbullet
  • Send Current URL to Readability
  • Send Current URL to Toodledo (via Drafts)
  • Shorten URL (via Short Menu)

Drafts URL Actions

  • Send to MacBook
  • Send to Write

Launch Center Pro Actions

  • Add to Markdown List in Dropbox
  • Add to Trello Grocery List
  • Copy GIF to Clipboard or Message
  • Delayed Communication
  • Drive to Location in Waze
  • Fenced Event (Actual Events)
  • Fenced Event (Reminder)
  • Find Pinboard Pins by Tag
  • Generic Search
  • Mega Maps
  • Multiple New Tasks in OmniFocus
  • New Task in OmniFocus
  • New Task in OmniFocus (via URL)
  • Send Clipboard to Editorial
  • Send Clipboard to Pushbullet
  • Smarter Tweetbot User Search
  • Toggle WeMo Switch
  • URL Encode/Decode Text
  • Work with Scanned Text

Mobile Bookmarklets

Each URL action below is a bookmark stored within my mobile browser. Simply paste this text into your bookmark URL and you’re good to go. Note that in order to use these actions, you must have the “destination” apps installed on your device. Also note that my URL schemes assume Safari is your browser; it should be fairly trivial to change them to accommodate Dolphin, Chrome, etc.

Append Current URL to Evernote Note (via Drafts)

Makes use of a Drafts action called “Add to Evernote Note”, which uses Drafts to append to an Evernote note.

Required Apps: Browser, Drafts

javascript:window.location=’drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&action=Add%20to%20Evernote%20Note’ + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-error=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Buffer

Sends the current URL to Buffer.

Required Apps: Browser, Buffer

javascript:window.location=’bufferapp://?t=’ + document.title + ‘ ‘ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘ | ‘

Send Current URL to Drafts

Sends the current URL to Drafts (in the form of the URL’s title, a newline, and the URL itself).

Required Apps: Browser, Drafts

javascript:window.location=’drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=’ + encodeURIComponent(document.title) + ‘%0A’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Instapaper

Sends the current URL to Instapaper.

Required Apps: Browser, Instapaper

javascript:window.location=’x-callback-instapaper://x-callback-url/add?url=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-error=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to MacBook

Sends the current URL to OS X via Command-C.

Required Apps: Browser, Command-C

javascript:window.location=’command-c://x-callback-url/copyText?deviceName=&text=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-error=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to OmniFocus

Sends the current URL to OmniFocus (with the document title acting as the task title and the URL as the task note).

Required Apps: Browser, Omnifocus

javascript:window.location=’omnifocus:///add?name=URL: ‘ + encodeURIComponent(document.title) + ‘¬e=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Pinboard (via Pinner)

Sends the current URL to Pinboard via Pinner.

Required Apps: Browser, Pinner

javascript:window.location=’pinner://x-callback-url/bookmark?href=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&title=’ + encodeURIComponent(document.title) + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Pinboard (via Pinswift)

Sends the current URL to Pinboard via Pinswift.

Required Apps: Browser, Pinswift

javascript:window.location=’pinswift://x-callback-url/add?url=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-cancel=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Pushbullet

Sends the current URL to Pushbullet as a link.

Required Apps: Browser, Pushbullet

javascript:window.location=’pushbullet://compose?type=link&title=’ + encodeURIComponent(document.title) + ‘&url=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Send Current URL to Readability

Adds the current URL to Readability.

Required Apps: Browser, Readability

javascript:window.location=’readability://add/’ + window.location

Send Current URL to Toodledo (via Drafts)

Makes use of a Drafts action called “List in Reminders” (which, as the name suggests, adds your URL as a new Reminder). Given that I have Reminder Syncing enabled, this adds my URL to Reminders and opens the Toodledo app for a nice, quick sync.

Required Apps: Browser, Drafts, Toodledo

javascript:window.location=’drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&action=List%20in%20Reminders&x-success=toodledo://’

Shorten URL (via Short Menu)

Takes the current URL, shortens it (via Short Menu), then places that shortened URL on the clipboard.

Required Apps: Browser, Short Menu

javascript:window.location=’shortmenu://x-callback-url/shortenURL?longURL=’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location) + ‘&x-success=http://’ + encodeURIComponent(window.location)

Drafts URL Actions

I have no words to adequately describe Drafts. It is an indispensable part of my toolkit (for, among other reasons, its ability to send text to any URL action).

Send to MacBook

Import Into Drafts

Sends the selected draft to OS X via Command-C.

Required Apps: Drafts, Command-C

command-c://x-callback-url/copyText?deviceName=&text=[[draft]]

Send to Write

Import Into Drafts

Sends the selected draft to Write. Uses the first line as the title of the document and the remaining lines as the body.

Required Apps: Drafts, Write

writeapp://x-callback-url/note?title=[[title]]&content[[body]]

Launch Center Pro Actions

I’ve finally gotten to the point where I have a collection of Launch Center Pro actions that are worth sharing. Note that I’m not going to put every action I have; I’m going to withhold the ones that can be built using the default action builder in LCP. Also note that I’ve not included “Install” links for some of the more specialized ones; in those cases, it will take less effort for you to copy/paste/change than to install mine and have to rip them apart.

Add to Markdown List in Dropbox

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Takes multiple lines of entered text and appends them to a Dropbox text file as Markdown list items (i.e., they get prefixed with a *). Simply download the action, replace the token text below with valid entries for your circumstance, and you should be good to go.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, TextTool, Dropbox

texttool://x-callback-url/transform?text=[prompt-return:Question(s)]&method=list&style=asterisk&x-success={{launch://dropbox/append?text=[[output]]&path={{YOUR PATH GOES HERE}}&name={{YOUR FILENAME GOES HERE}}}}

Add to Trello Grocery List

Adds a provided item to one Trello list out of a predefined set. I use this to quickly add grocery items to the correct list (e.g., Apples to Safeway). Note that the easiest way to get the List ID from Trello is to take a look at the JSON of your board; you can find it in the menu on the right in Trello.

I encourage you to check out my comprehensive writeup on how I use this method to manage my grocery lists.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Trello

trello://x-callback-url/createCard?shortlink=[BOARD-SHORTLINK-GOES-HERE]&name=[prompt:Item]&list-id=[list:Grocery Stores|Safeway=[SAFEWAY LIST ID|CostCo=[COSTCO LIST ID]|Target=[TARGET LIST ID]]

Copy GIF to Clipboard or Message

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Provides two options: copy a user-chosen animated GIF (from Giphy) to the clipboard or send it in a message.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro

[list:Options|Message GIF=http://launchmessaging?to=[contact]&attach=photo:gif|Copy GIF=launch://clipboard?attach=photo:gif]

Delayed Communication

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Sends a delayed SMS/Message, email, or phone call. Sets a reminder for a later date/time and when that time arrives, provides a link to initiate the appropriate action (e.g., revise and send the email).

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Due

Inspiration: Schedule a Text x Minutes From Now with Due and Launch Center Pro

[list:Type|Delayed Call=due://x-callback-url/add?title={{tel[contact]}}&minslater=[prompt-num:Minutes]|Delayed SMS=due://x-callback-url/add?title={{launch://messaging?to=[contact]&body=[prompt:Message]}}&minslater=[prompt-num:Minutes]|Delayed Email=due://x-callback-url/add?title={{launch://email?to=[contact]&subject=[prompt:Subject]&body=[prompt:Body]}}&minslater=[prompt-num:Minutes]]&lc-icon=due

Drive to Location in Waze

Automatically navigates to a predefined latitude/longitude in Waze. Simply add the coordinates to your favorite spots.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Waze

waze://?ll=[list:Locations|Open…|Home=00.00000,000.00000|Work=00.00000,000.00000]&navigate=yes

Fenced Event (Actual Events)

This is a more complex version of the version below. For more information, view my full post on it: True Fenced Events in Fantastical

Fenced Event (Reminder)

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Sometimes, I need to schedule event and schedule driving time to and from the event; this workflow reminds me to do that automatically: it creates an event in Fantastical and creates a reminder in OmniFocus (via a Drafts email action that uses a user’s Mail Drop email address) to add driving time around that event.

Notice the ! in front of the [clipboard] element; this makes sure that [clipboard] gets resolved in this second iteration.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Fantastical, Drafts, Mail Drop

launch://x-callback-url/clipboard?text=[prompt:Event]&x-success={{fantastical2://x-callback-url/parse?sentence=[clipboard]&add=1&x-success={{drafts://x-callback-url/create?text={{Create time block around event: }}[!clipboard]&action={{Email to OmniFocus}}&x-success={{launch://}}}}}}&lc-icon=fantastical

Find Pinboard Pins by Tag

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Searches for pins by tag in Pinboard (via Pinswift); additionally, provides quick selection for favorite tags.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Pinswift

pinswift:///t:[list:Tags|Search…=[prompt:Tags]|Favorite Tag 1=fav-tag-1]

Generic Search

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Provides a means to search many different services from a single location.

Of particular note is the + in front of the prompt for Wikipanion. For some reason, using Wikipanion’s URL scheme in a list like this causes mutli-word searches to fail; the + forces LCP to encode the prompt one more time (as per this documentation).

Required Apps: Browser, Launch Center Pro, Fantastical, Terminology, Wikipanion, WolframAlpha

[list:Search|YouTube=http://www.youtube.com/results?q=[prompt:Query]|Fantastical=fantastical2://search?query=[prompt:Query]&scope=all|Terminology=terminology://x-callback-url/lookup?text=[prompt:Word]|Wikipedia=wikipanion:///[+prompt:Query]|WolframAlpha=wolframalpha:///?i=[prompt:Query]|Amazon=http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss?url=search-alias=aps&field-keywords=[prompt:Query]|AlternativeTo=http://alternativeto.net/SearchResult.aspx?search=[prompt:Query]|NerdQuery=http://nerdquery.com/?media_only=0&search=1&category=-1&catid=&type=and&results=50&db=0&prefix=0&query=[prompt:Query]]

Mega Maps

Import Into Launch Center Pro

A wonderful action that allows users to search for locations or get directions (in either Apple or Google Maps).

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Maps, Google Maps

Inspiration: https://twitter.com/tahewett/status/490853838060937216

[list:Map App|Apple Maps=[list:Maps Actions|Search Location=http://maps.apple.com/?q=[prompt:Search Location…]|Directions=http://maps.apple.com/?daddr=[prompt:Destination]&saddr=[list:From Where…?|Current Location=|Other=[prompt:From Where…?]]]|Google Maps=[list:Google Maps Actions|Search Location=comgooglemaps://?q=[prompt:Search Location…]|Directions=comgooglemaps://?saddr=[list:From Where…?|Current Location=|Other=[prompt:From Where…?]]&daddr=[prompt:Destination]&directionsmode=[list:What kind of directions…?|Driving=driving|Walking=walking|Bicycling=bicycling|Transit=transit]]]&lc-icon=maps

Multiple New Tasks in OmniFocus

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Creates multiple new OmniFocus tasks within Launch Center Pro.

Previously, I was accomplishing this by sending multiple tasks to Drafts and using the List in Reminders action; this, in turn, would feed into OmniFocus’ Reminders integration to add the tasks. The primary issue: it required that OmniFocus open in order to import those tasks. That caused too much friction; I like to stay (or end up) in LCP whenever possible.

Notice the use of the + symbol in the prompt; this forces multiple lines to be URL-encoded (as %0A) before being sent to Pythonista.

This action depends on a great Pythonista script written by Nathan Henrie; make sure you read, understand, and set up that script before using this action.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Mail Drop, Pythonista, Gmail

Inspiration: MultiLineOmniFocus V2: Improved Launch Center Pro and Callback Support

pythonista://MultiLineOmniFocus?action=run&argv=[+prompt-return:Tasks]&argv={{launch:}}#lc-icon=omnifocus

New Task in OmniFocus

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Provides a list to add three “types” of OmniFocus task:

  1. A standard task
  2. Multiple standard tasks at once
  3. A “Follow Up” task variant

Several things to note with this action:

  • Although OmniFocus on iOS comes with a URL scheme, this action doesn’t use it; in order to reduce the friction of jumping from LCP to OmniFocus – and given that OmniFocus doesn’t provide a URL scheme to return to LCP – this action uses IFTTT and OmniFocus Mail Drop.
  • The action works by using Drafts actions to send tasks into OmniFocus. For #1 and #3 above, an Email to OmniFocus action is used to send the task to OmniFocus via Mail Drop; for #2 above, the List in Reminders action is used to import each line of the draft into Reminders – naturally, this assumes that you have OmniFocus set up to import tasks from Reminders.

In both cases, the user is returned to LCP afterward.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Mail Drop, IFTTT

Inspiration: More Ways to Send Tasks to OmniFocus with Launch Center Pro and Drafts

[list:Type|Task=drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=[prompt:Title]%0A[prompt:Note]&action={{Email to OmniFocus}}&x-success={{launchpro://}}|Multiple Tasks=drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=[prompt-return:Tasks]&action={{List in Reminders}}&x-success={{launchpro://}}|Follow Up=drafts://x-callback-url/create?text={{Follow up w/}}[prompt:Person]{{ re: }}[prompt:Topic]%0A[prompt:Note]&action={{Email to OmniFocus}}&x-success={{launchpro://}}]&lc-icon=omnifocus

New Task in OmniFocus (via URL)

This action creates a new OmniFocus task based on a passed URL. For more information, view my full post on it: OmniFocus Tasks from URLs on iOS

Send Clipboard to Editorial

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Sends the text on the clipboard to a user-defined document in Editorial. Note that this version uses Dropbox as Editorial’s storage location; feel free to change that.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Editorial

editorial://new/[prompt:Filename]?root={{dropbox}}&command={{Paste as…}}

Send Clipboard to Pushbullet

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Sends the text on the clipboard to Pushbullet. The action provides options to send a note, a link, an address, or an image. Note that although Pushbullet has a URL scheme, this action uses IFTTT triggers for a more frictionless experience. Each of these triggers is connected to a corresponding IFTTT recipe.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, IFTTT

launch://ifttt/trigger?name=[list:Type|Note=Send Pushbullet Note|Link=Send Pushbullet Link|Address=Send Pushbullet Address|Image=Send Pushbullet Image]&value1=[clipboard]&lc-icon=pushbullet

Toggle WeMo Switch

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Toggles a WeMo switch via an IFTTT recipe. Supremely useful, especially given that the WeMo iOS app doesn’t have a URL scheme.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, IFTTT

launch://ifttt/trigger?name={{Toggle Dining Light}}&lc-icon=wemo

Smarter Tweetbot User Search

Import Into Launch Center Pro

While traversing the web, I often run across Twitter users I want to start following. However, I have a fundamental problem: I don’t log into Twitter on Safari; I’d rather use Tweetbot.

This action assumes that I’ve copied either a Twitter username or a link to a Twitter profile (such as http://twitter.com/bachya) to the clipboard; once in place, the action strips the username and searches for it in Tweetbot.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, TextTool, Tweetbot

texttool://x-callback-url/transform?text=[clipboard]&method=regex&search={{https?://(.+\.)?twitter\.com/}}&replace=&x-success={{tweetbot:///user_profile/[[output]]}}&lc-icon=tweetbot

URL Encode/Decode Text

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Converts user-prompted text by either URL encoding or decoding it and placing the result on the clipboard.

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro

[list:Action|URL Encode=launch://x-callback-url/clipboard?text=[prompt:Text]&x-success={{launch://clipboard/convert?format={{urlencode}}}}|URL Decode=launch://x-callback-url/clipboard?text=[prompt:Text]&x-success={{launch://clipboard/convert?format={{urldecode}}}}]

Work with Scanned Text

Import Into Launch Center Pro

Opens Prizmo to scan some text; upon a successful scan, returns to LCP and prompts the user to copy the scanned text to the clipboard or send it to Pushbullet. Note that the Pushbullet route makes use of an existing LCP action (defined with an action ID of 116).

Required Apps: Launch Center Pro, Prizmo, Pushbullet

Inspiration: Sharing Prizmo OCR to Drafts, Cloudier and Dropbox

prizmo://x-callback-url/captureText?language=en&destination=pasteboard&x-success={{launch:}}&lc-callback=[list:Next Step?|Copy to Clipboard=launch://clipboard?text=[clipboard]|Pushbullet=[action:116]]&cancel={{launch:}}

Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
